channel.title: Need help finding software for vocals
channel.description: Hey everyone. So I’ve been wanting to do vocals on my music but I’m looking for software that is affordable and good to use. I already know how to transfer my song to my pc I just need to find software to use so I can sing. Any suggestions?

item.title: Need help finding software for vocals
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
I have no experience with it, but aside from Autotune mobile and Voloco there’s also Voice Jam Studio. I have the Voice Rack: FX product, it’s ok.

Both of those are by TC Helicon, pretty well known in the desktop space.

To be honest, any kind of serious vocal editing (pitch/timing correction etc) is super seriously lacking. You’re probably going to want to bring it into desktop land if you need to do heavy editing.

Voloco is cool as an effect, I wouldn’t use it to treat vocals if you want to preserve the performance. Voice Rack FX is the same (to be honest, I’ve used it as an AUv3 on other stuff like basslines and guitars lol…).

That’s about all I know about these kinds of apps

Read full topic

item.title: Need help finding software for vocals
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
In case this is still of interest to anyone, I think yesterday or the day before Tracktion T7 went free

Synthtopia – 13 Aug 18

Free DAW, Tracktion T7, For Linux, Mac & Windows

Tracktion Software has released Tracktion T7 as a free download.

Supports Windows, Mac and Linux. Good write up here as well-

CDM Create Digital Music – 13 Aug 18

Tracktion 7: powerful, free audio production tool (Mac, Windows, Linux) - CDM...

So you want to start recording, mixing, arranging, and your budget is ... you don't have one. Tracktion runs on every OS, and the latest update adds still more powerful features.

There’s plenty of options for this kind of stuff, but as far as TOTALLY free stuff I only know of this and Cakewalk as mentioned above.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help finding software for vocals

item.title: Need help finding software for vocals
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Was just thinking about this thread, for something pure iOS you could consider Voloco. Check out the effect screen:

Also this neat little shout out

You import a full track with this and can sing over it. The downside is that it doesn’t let you do any mixing. I think you could finagle something with background audio and then use GarageBand iOS to mix everything together, but anyways.

Voloco is free for starter pack effects I believe. A fiver nets you everything.

Anyways, just a thought.

Read full topic

item.source: Need help finding software for vocals

item.title: Need help finding software for vocals
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Cakewalk was purchased by BandLab, there was an article about it a few weeks back on CDM.

CDM Create Digital Music – 4 Apr 18

Cakewalk SONAR DAW for Windows is back - and it's now free - CDM Create Digital...

One of Windows' most powerful, most popular, most native-optimized audio tools is not only back from the dead, it's available for free. A version of SONAR Platinum will be available free, and finally, it's just called "Cakewalk."

So yeah I’d say it’s cool.
